perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Sweden.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law from Japan to Sweden could potentially remove mandatory consumer protections that exist in Japan but not in Sweden, or vice versa, in areas such as dispute resolution or product liability depending on the context of the agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Japanese Consumer Contract Act (Act No. 61 of 2000)
perturbation.law_explanation: The Japanese Consumer Contract Act provides specific protections for consumers. By changing the governing law to Swedish law, the contract attempts to circumvent these protections, which may be legally challenged if the agreement concerns Japanese consumers or activities within Japan. This constitutes a legal contradiction and omission of consumer rights under Japanese law. Note that the second URL does not link directly to an english translation of the Act. Rather, it links to a japanese language document on consumer protection provided by the Cabinet Office.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of Directors and Officers with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'and 4.3.3' the range of indemnification is diminished, possibly removing liability coverage. This could affect mandatory D&O insurance requirements.
perturbation.law_citation: 会社法 第430条 [Companies Act, Article 430]
perturbation.law_explanation: Article 430 of the Japan Companies Act pertains to the liability of directors and officers and the company's ability to indemnify them under certain conditions. By removing the clause that ensures compliance with Sections 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement, the modified text potentially weakens the directors' and officers' protection regarding liabilities, possibly contradicting the spirit and provisions related to D&O responsibilities under the Japan Companies Act. (The second link is a link to the japanese language electronic legal code.)
